repnme.cdata!:
Russian Federation - Second Tax
            Administration Modernization Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Tax
            Administration Modernization Project (TAMP II) for Russian
            Federation were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower
            performance was moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: high-level Government and Federal Tax
            Service (FTS) ownership of the project and tax
            administration reforms remained consistently high.
            Importantly, technical-level ownership and change management
            within the FTS was embedded through thematic working groups
            in Ministry of Taxes and Fees (MinTax) and then the FTS.
            These working groups penetrated very deep into the operating
            levels of the tax administration and provided strong
            continuity even through wrenching organizational
            restructurings and changes in MinTax and FTS leadership. The
            working groups also functioned, contrary to conventional
            wisdom which sometimes doubts the efficacy of such change
            agents internal to an organization, as key channels to
            introduce and sustain incremental institutional change,
            modernized business processes, and related automation. It
            appears that the high organizational pride and esprit de
            corps so manifest across the entire FTS contributed
            significantly to this achievement. The importance of the
            thematic working groups in keeping the banners of ownership,
            change management and incremental reforms flying through
            difficult times cannot be over-estimated.

Russian Federation - Second Tax

repnme.cdata!:
Russia - Second Tax Administration
            Modernization Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Second
            Tax Administration Modernization Project is to implement
            systematic reform, and modernization of the tax
            administration in Russia, to increase administrative
            efficiency, strengthen enforcement capacity, enhance skills,
            and improve tax legislation. Under three general areas - tax
            administration management; tax administration operations;
            and, project management - the components will: a) support
            implementation of the functional structure, which includes
            the reorganization of territorial, and local tax offices,
            with further development of the federal level structure
            based on the organizations, and structure analysis. The
            review and strengthening of organizational units in MinTax,
            and at the regional level for formulation of operational
            strategy will be supported, by targeting operational areas,
            developing performance indicators, and preparing annual
            business plans. Moreover, business processes will be
            standardized, revenue forecasting and tax modeling systems
            developed, and strategies for managing organizational change
            supported, as will human resource management, and improved
            professional ethics. Infrastructure will be developed,
            including computerization and telecommunications; 2) support
            the development of a legal and regulatory framework, to
            assist line ministries in reviewing tax laws and
            regulations, and strengthen the appeals system. An
            electronic filing and tax payment accounting systems will be
            established, while audit and investigation systems will
            ensure compliance with processing, and policies; and, 3)
            assist in managing project implementation, covering the
            costs of project management, including assistance in the
            analysis of the implementation progress, and performance.
